result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven J Yepez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed by Judge Ralph M. Ramirez on October 15, 2015.
records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Sarah Ponath

Defendant Steven J Yepez in court with attorney Sarah A Ponath.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case dismissed and read into case # 14CT620.  Bail to be applied to case # 14CT620.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Sarah A Ponath in court.   Defendant Steven J Yepez did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ponath makes statements regarding her clients non-appearance.  Court issues a capias, revokes and forfeits bail, but stays it until the next hearing.  Case recalled at 10:16 am.  Defendant appeared.  Court cancels stayed capias, bail remains as fixed.  Court sets this case for a pleas.

Defendant Steven J Yepez in court with attorney Sarah A Ponath.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Ponath received discovery and pretrial offer in court and requests time to review with client.  Hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant to pay: $50.00 per month commencing 7/15/15.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven J Yepez in court, in custody.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests court appointed attorney.  Defendant was told in an earlier hearing today that he is not eligible for a State Public Defender.  Court reviews defendant's information for petition for appointment of counsel on the record.  Court grants defendant's request for appointment of counsel.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant Steven J Yepez in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
